citation.article-title: Pseudomonas thermotolerans sp. nov., a thermotolerant species of the genus Pseudomonas sensu stricto.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas thermotolerans sp. nov.
Pseudomonas thermotolerans (ther.mo.to'le.rans. Gr. n. therme heat; L. pres. part. tolerans tolerating; N.L. adj. thermotolerans able to tolerate high temperatures)
Cells are motile by a single polar flagellum.
Colonies grown on LA medium are not pigmented and are 1-2 mm in diameter after 24 h growth; fluorescence is not produced on King B medium.
Growth occurs above 25°C and below 56°C; the optimal growth temperature for strain CM3T is approximately 47°C.
Growth occurs at pH 6 and pH 10.
Major fatty acids are C16:0, C16:1 and C18:1; cyclo-C19 is present at temperatures above 37°C.
The hydroxylated fatty acids 3-OH C10:0 and 3-OH C12:0 are also present.
Ubiquinone 9 is the major respiratory quinone.
Strictly aerobic and positive for cytochrome oxidase, catalase and arginine dihydrolase.
The nutritional pattern reveals an inability to use sugars and a preference for carbon sources with long hydrocarbon chains.
The DNA G+C content of strain CM3T is 66.4 mol%.
Isolated from cooking water of industrial cork transformation.
Isolate CM3T (=DSM 14292T=LMG 21284T) is the type strain.
